episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of fascinating topics including an AI developed by MIT that can predict human interactions, the leaning of Big Ben, the early confusion over how to use aspirin, and historical plans for space travel by Oliver Cromwell's brother-in-law.

facts.fact: Scientists at MIT have invented an artificial intelligence that can see into the future, but it can only tell two seconds into the future.
When aspirin tablets were first introduced, people were unsure how to take them, so one patient ended up strapping them to his head to cure a headache.
The first British plans to put a human on the moon were made by Oliver Cromwell's brother-in-law.
